technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: YouTube
technologies.description: YouTube is a video sharing service where users can create their own profile, upload videos, watch, like and comment on other videos.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains CSS and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

technologies.name: Nginx
technologies.description: Nginx is a web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache.

technologies.name: Yoast SEO
technologies.description: Yoast SEO is a search engine optimisation plugin for WordPress and other platforms.

technologies.name: OpenResty
technologies.description: OpenResty is a web platform based on nginx which can run Lua scripts using its LuaJIT engine.

technologies.name: WPML
technologies.description: WPML plugin makes it possible to build and run fully multilingual WordPress sites.

technologies.name: OWL Carousel
technologies.description: OWL Carousel is an enabled jQuery plugin that lets you create responsive carousel sliders.

technologies.name: jsDelivr
technologies.description: JSDelivr is a free public CDN for open-source projects. It can serve web files directly from the npm registry and GitHub repositories without any configuration.

technologies.name: Google Tag Manager
technologies.description: Google Tag Manager is a tag management system (TMS) that allows you to quickly and easily update measurement codes and related code fragments collectively known as tags on your website or mobile app.

technologies.name: jQuery UI
technologies.description: jQuery UI is a collection of GUI widgets, animated visual effects, and themes implemented with jQuery, Cascading Style Sheets, and HTML.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: Google Analytics
technologies.description: Google Analytics is a free web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.

technologies.name: Facebook Pixel
technologies.description: Facebook pixel is an analytics tool that allows you to measure the effectiveness of your advertising.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: reCAPTCHA
technologies.description: reCAPTCHA is a free service from Google that helps protect websites from spam and abuse.

technologies.name: Google Hosted Libraries
technologies.description: Google Hosted Libraries is a stable, reliable, high-speed, globally available content distribution network for the most popular, open-source JavaScript libraries.

technologies.name: Microsoft 365
technologies.description: Microsoft 365 is a line of subscription services offered by Microsoft as part of the Microsoft Office product line.

technologies.name: Popper
technologies.description: Popper is a positioning engine, its purpose is to calculate the position of an element to make it possible to position it near a given reference element.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: HTTP/3
technologies.description: HTTP/3 is the third major version of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol used to exchange information on the World Wide Web.
